p: In general, the coastal sample of the H. curassavicum EO showed a greater allelopathic effect than the inland samples, and the MeOH extract was stronger in allelopathic activity than the EO. This may be attributed to the effect of habitats, particularly that the coastal habitat is more stressful than the inland habitat due to the effect of salinity, where the plants produce more bioactive compounds in order to tolerate the harsh conditions [ 62, 63].
